A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm not a critic\, nor claim to be one. 
However\, this film is garbage. 

Lets start with the largest of Disney's sins. 

They gave complete Narrative and Directive control to Rian Johnson. A rookie director\, whose best example of directing was a fairly good episode of Breaking Bad. A self proclaimed "Fan" of Star Wars. He made quite a few missteps here with Fans. To the point of argument. My biggest question is: Did he even care to have a Lore-Master go over the Script with him? Or was he too confident in his own writings to completely miss aspects he couldn't afford to.

On top of that:

Everything JJ Abrams set up in the Previous Installment is just disregarded. 

This film is just mired in mediocrity.

Any attempt at deep storytelling is passed over. We're left with shallow characters\, cheesy clichéd dialogue\, and unresolved subplots. I've heard the term "Trigger Happy Flyboy" (or thereabouts) in too many Hollywood films.
 The Codebreaker subplot just stopped the story dead\, and ultimately failed to resolve. It begs the question as to why it was even included. 

Another thing was how bad certain Cameo looked. I couldn't tell if it was CG or Puppetry. It just looked very off-putting and unrealistic.

This film didnt connect with me\, I was excited to see where this franchise was headed\, even after the previous installment took a very odd direction. 

Disney screwed the pooch. I dont know if they'll recover from this.
